They bitin'?Oh, fine.No, no.Had dinner at a place called the King's Table. Buffet style. It was pretty darn good.Yah, not too bad. So it's nice up there?No, I'm leavin' this mornin', back up to Brainerd.Mm. But ya think he's all right? I saw him last night and he's -Well, it was nothin' specific he said, it just seemd like it all hit him really hard, his wife dyin' -Linda.Linda Cooksey?So ... they didn't...Oh. Oh, my.Oh. Geez.Geez. Well - geez. That's a suprise.Hello?Mr. Lundegaard? Sorry to bother you again. Can I come in?I unnerstand. I'll keep it real short, then. I'm on my way out of town, but I was just - Do you mind if I sit down? I'm carrying a bit of a load here.Yah, it's this vehicle I asked you about yesterday. I was just wondering -Okay, are you sure, cause, I mean, how do you know? Because, see, the crime I'm investigating, the perpetrators were driving a car with dealer plates. And they called someone who works here, so it'd be quite a coincidence if they weren't, ya know, connected.So how do you - have you done any kind of inventory recently?but do you know that for sure without -Yah, but -I know, but - well, how do you establish that, sir? Are the cars, uh, counted daily or what kind of -... I'm sorry, sir?Sir, you have no call to get snippy with me. I'm just doin' my job here.Sir, could I talk to Mr. Gustafson?... Mr. Lundegaard?Sir? Right now?I'm sorry, sir, I -... Oh, for Pete's sake.... Oh, for Pete's sake...... For Pete's s- he's fleein' the interview. He's feelin' the interview...... Detective Sibert, please...Uh-huh.And his wife?Geez. Looks like this thing goes higher than we thought. You call his home?Oh, my.Boy, this thing is really ... geez.Yah. Well, I just can't thank you enough, Detective Sibert, this cooperation has been outstanding.End a April.This'll be our first. We've been waiting a long time.Oh, yah, I know that!You have children?Oh, now he's adorable.Oh, he's adorable.Where'd you get him that parka?Oh, no, I can't let you do that.Well, okay - thank you, Detective.The day of our homicides.And this guy is...Gustafson's accountant.But we still haven't found Gustafson.Sorry - didn't copy.Copy. And Lundegaard too.Oh, I'm almost back - I'm driving around Moose Lake.Yah, the loudmouth. So the whole state has it, Lundegaard and Gustafson?Copy.There's the car! There's the car!My car! My car! Tan Ciera!Copy. Yah, send me back-up!Yah, Menominie only has Chief Perpich and he takes February off to go to Boundary Waters.Stop! Police! Turn around and hands up!... Hands up!... Police!... Halt!... Halt!... Halt!... All right, buddy. On your belly and your hands clasped behind you.... So that was Mrs. Lundegaard in there?... I guess that was your accomplice in the wood chipper.... And those three people in Brainerd.... And for what? For a little bit of money.... There's more to life than money, you know.... Don't you know that?... And here ya are, and it's a beautiful day...... Well...... I just don't unnerstand it.Oooph!They announced it?... So?Your mallard?Norm, that's terrific!It's terrific!Oh, for Pete's - a course they do! Every time they raise the darned postage, people need the little stamps!When they're stuck with a bunch a the old ones!That's terrific.... I'm so proud a you, Norm.I love you, Norm.Two more months.
